page.title: 06FARMING-UPPER RHYMNEY VALLEY
page.content: Much farming in the Upper Rhymney Valley, is mainly on land reclaimed from the coal and iron mines of the last century.The land has been flattened and seeded for rough pasture.Many consider that this new{ {pasture}is not as productive as the old established pasture. There is no arable farming in the area and animals kept are mostly Welsh mountain sheep which produce fleece.The sheep are kept for about 4 seasons and served by 1 ram.Lambs are sold when 7-8 months old before winter sets in. There are small numbers of Welsh Black Cattle and there is one pig farm in the area, together with small numbers of goats and poultry. Each farm supports two or three horses, but there are a considerable number of wild ponies on the hillside.
